title: How a New Accounting Rule Is Making Bank Earnings Go Wild
sub_head: ‘I think it’s crazy,’ JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says
body:
Net income doesn’t mean what it used to.
Since the start of 2020, bank profits have been on a volatile swing reminiscent of the financial crisis. Banks have faced a global pandemic, a sharp but short-lived recession and an economy that is full of unusual wrinkles, but the profit swings belie that their revenue has remained flat and their performance has been steady.
